intro: Cerastium valdehirsutum, commonly known as the hairy mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes carnations and other flowering plants. The plant features small, white flowers that bloom in early spring, often in clusters at the ends of its stems. Its leaves are typically hairy and heart-shaped, which helps in identifying the species. Cerastium valdehirsutum thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks.
